conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for the ＂Elementary Escapades＂ event and Chapter 7 of the main campaign.
Phew. I'm all done clearin' fiends outta the east woods, Cleo.
Thank you, Ranzal. If you could see to the west side now, that would be lovely.
Seriously? You're killin' me here!
I trust you haven't forgotten the little promise we made when I caught you absconding with my dinner ingredients.
If I recall correctly, your exact words were ＂Aw, c'mon, I'll make it up to ya. I'll hunt all the fiends you want!＂
Grnk! Did I say that? See, what I MEANT was—
If you could see to the west side now, that would be LOVELY. THANK YOU.
*sigh...* Yes, ma'am. Guess I'm headin' back out.
NWAAAUGH!
Oh, butterfingers. Another experiment just BARELY got away from me! Sorry about that. You all right?
Yeah... More or less.
WHOA! Uh... So. Hey. I'm about to tell you something. Don't freak out.
Why would I freak out? And why're you starin', SinoaaaAAAH MY VOICE! My body!
AGAIN, Sinoa? You kiddified me AGAIN?!
Hold on a sec, maybe I can work with this. I mighta got thrown for a minute there, but this timing's perfect.
Even Cleo can't send me out huntin' fiends like this. Hah, best freak explosion I ever got caught up in!
Plus, things've been quiet with the Emile Academy, so there ain't any need to send me off on another undercover mission.
Which means there's only one thing for me to do:
Catch a Z or three!
Ahhh. I've been playin' danger tag with fiends for way too long. Haven't had a decent rest in ages!
But nobody can yell at a kid for lazin' around. That's practically their job.
I'm spendin' every minute I can in bed till Sinoa's mad science wears off.
...Dammit. I can't stay asleep.
I was dead tired, but one little nap later, I'm back to full charge. Forgot just how quick kids are to bounce back.
My body's practically aching to go run around. What's a guy even DO with this much energy?
Not work, I'll tell ya that much! Guess I'll...play? There ARE other kids here.
...Yeaaah, no. I need somethin' I can do solo what'll tucker me out.
Aha! I got just the thing!
Awright, that should do it for the materials. Heh, I'm gettin' way too excited about this for a guy my age.
Brings me back, though. I used to love adventure stories as a kid. Especially the ones with tree forts in 'em!
There's just somethin' cool about having a secret base way up high. Always wanted to build one of my own.
Never got the chance until now, though. That'll teach me to give up on my dreams! Ha ha!
Phew. That's the foundation put together. Next up is...
Aw mannn, you caught me...
Heh heh! Now it's your turn to be ＂it!＂
Wait. What's that sound?
Now I'm curious, too. Let's go find out!
Whoa! That kid's building something on top of that tree!
Ooh, I know! It's a SECRET HIDEOUT!
Huh? Oh, it's a couple of runts. Must be from town.
Hey! You're building a secret base, right?!
Uhhh... Yeah, I guess?
I knew it! That's so cool! Can I help?!
Um, I want to help too, if that's okay...
Ehhh...
(Sorry, but I wasn't really lookin' to spend my day babysitting here, fellas.)
Is that...a no?
Awww, this guy's no fun...
(Bah. Guess it wouldn't be very mature of me to just run 'em off.)
(Besides, I know how it feels to get left out in the cold on the whole building-a-secret- hideout dream.)
All right, all right. C'mon, let's get this thing put together.
Yesss! This is gonna be AWESOME!
But some of this work's dangerous. You guys are just helpin' with the easy bits, understood?
Yeah, sure! Here, I'll carry this lumber up the tree!
Whoa, whoa. Easy, tiger! You plannin' on climbing a ladder with an armful of wood? That's just ASKIN' for a nasty fall!
Then, um... How do we get it up there?
First you climb up, THEN you haul the lumber up with a rope.
If somebody stays down there and helps lift it from below, it'll go up twice as easy.
Whoa... That makes so much sense. Hey, you're pretty smart!
Picked that one up back in my mercenary days. We scaled a cliff face to get the drop on the enemy, then...
...Huh?
You know what, never mind. Look, don't sweat the details.
Now c'mon. This thing ain't gonna build itself!
Right!
And so construction proceeded without a hitch. The base was soon completed, and somehow nobody got hurt in the process!
Heh... How's that for a vista? I'd say we built a damn fine base, boyos!
Whoa... We're so high up!
I still can't believe we built something this amazing all by ourselves.
Yeah! We just did exactly what he said and it came together like magic!
From now on, you're our leader, Ranzal!
Sorry, but I'm not lookin' to be boss of the babies, kid. Kinda embarrassing, y'know?
Aw, I think it'd be really great. With you leading us, every day would be an adventure!
Right?! I wanna do more stuff like this!
Please, Ranzal? Pleeeeease?
(Rgh... The puppy dog eyes get me every time.)
Fiiine, sure, whatever you want. Guess I'm sultan of the squirts now.
Ha ha, yaaay! Thank you!
(Just don't count on me stickin' around forever, kids.)
(Still, it's better than twiddling the ol' thumbs until gremlin mode wears off.)
Get ready for a fastball! Heee-YAH!
Waugh...!
Steee-RIKE! You're out, buddy!
Awww. I totally blew it again. Okay, you're up to bat, Ranzal.
Nah, I'll stick with umpire. You two have fun.
(Actually playin' with these runts would be a little TOO embarrassing, thanks.)
Wait a minute... Ranzal, are you bad at baseball?
Excuse you? I'm not about to take that one lyin' down.
Okay, change of plans. Gimme the bat. One turn's all I'll need.
All right, that's what I'm talking about! Mweh heh heh. Here it comes!
Nice and straight. Come to papa. Aaand...home run!
Whoooa... I've never SEEN a ball go that far before!
HOLY MANACAKES! Are you that good at pitching, too? Here, you throw the next one!
Heh, fine. I'll throw a couple, if you really want. Just try not to wet your pants when you see the ball go supersonic.
As long as I stay in the shadow of this big rock, I shouldn't get caught...
In your dreams, maybe. Gotcha!
WAUGH?! Aw, maaan... You found me.
You gotta think one step ahead of the other guy, Chief. Go for the sorta place they wouldn't even think a person COULD hide!
Yesss! I caught an Alberian Hercules beetle!
Niiice. Let's see who's stronger: that guy or the rhinoceros beetle I just found!
You're on. Go, Herc, go! You got this!
Sorry, but that ain't happening. Get in there and give 'im hell, Big Rhino!
(Man, I went into this thinkin' I'd humor these runts for a bit, but...)
(Once you get past the cringe factor, bein' a kid again's basically the best.)
(Guess I shouldn't be surprised, considering...)
Now, young master Ranzal, for your next lesson...
Whaaat? There's MORE? I wanna go play!
I heard none of the other kids have to study this much. How come I'm the only one?
One day, you will be lord of Saint Lotier. You mustn't squander your days if you hope to be a wise leader like your father.
Now, let's begin your next lesson. Ready?
Okay...
(I don't have a single memory of goofin' off or playing with friends as a kid.)
(Maybe some part of me's been craving this kinda stupid, childish joy all my life.)
Oops. It's later than I thought. I should prob'ly get back home.
Oh jeez, you ain't kiddin'. Time flies when you're havin' fun, huh?
Today was the best! Can we play some more tomorrow, Ranzal?
You bet, buckaroo.
Yesss! Okay, let's meet up tomorrow at the secret hideout!
Yay! It's a plan!
Heh. See you guys tomorrow.
Kinda surreal to be talkin' to ANYONE about ＂tomorrow＂ like it's a sure thing.
Who'da thunk? Not me, especially back during my merc years...
Back in my merc days, ＂see you tomorrow＂ always came with a caveat.
One to the tune of ＂if we're still alive.＂
Ahhh, nothin' like a full belly to get a guy in the mood for some good, old fashioned bloodshed. Hope you fellas can keep up!
Just don't think I'll let you hog the glory. That general's head is mine. Once I cash in on that bounty, I'll be livin' the cushy life.
Hah hah! That's the spirit, kid. You give 'em hell!
Hey now, don't go rilin' the rookies up. Can't spend coin if you're dead.
There's the signal. All right, fellas! See your sorry mugs again soon— if we're still alive, that is!
Hear, hear!
Yeah. See you then. Make sure you survive so I've got somebody to brag to!
Hey, old timer. Good to see you're still kickin'.
Gah hah hah. Scraped through another one, so I did!
Glad you're still with us. By the way, you heard anything about that rookie?
Tsk. I knew that stupid kid was in over his head.
Our line a' work's always quick to reward the eager with a swift end.
How many people have I told I'd see them tomorrow, only for us to never meet again? I lost count early on.
That's about all a merc's life was worth, on the battlefield. Ain't nobody got time to be mourning every domino that falls.
You just had to let it go and move on. As a merc, your life is yours to risk or lose.
G'morning, Ranzal!
Hey, guys. Glad you could make it.
(One day I'm leavin' a trail of bodies on the battlefield, and now I'm here playin' pretend. Ya gotta laugh or you'll cry.)
(Little rays of sunshine, these rascals. It's almost enough to blind a guy.)
Get ready for my super fireball slider!
STRIKE! Aaand you're out!
Man, not again...
Heh heh. Okay, your turn to pitch! Let's trade spots!
...Okay! I'll give it my best shot!
(I spent my childhood chained to a desk. Never got a taste of this carefree stuff.)
(Then, after becoming a merc, well... I got my freedom, but I paid the cost in blood. Death was always around the corner.)
(Tch. I'm startin' to wish I didn't have to turn back into a grown-up after all.)
Yesss! Home run!
Dang. I thought that pitch was pretty good, too.
Now, where'd that ball go? ...Ah! Found it.
Grrrrrrr...
Huh?
WAAAUGH!
Was that a scream?!
What d'you think happened? You reckon he's okay?
No time for thinkin'! C'mon, we gotta move. NOW!
Somebody...help... I'm scaaared!
What's wrong?! Whoa! That's—
GRRRRRRR!
A fiend?!
Grrrrrr...
AAAAAH!
I'll distract it! You guys scram!
What?! But then you'll—
Hah! Don't worry 'bout me, Chief. I'm used to a good tussle!
(Rgh! Definitely missin' that muscle right about now. This won't be as easy as usual, but...)
You ain't settin' one grimy claw on these kids! Now, COME GET SOME!
(Hah. Look at that. My body's actin' on pure reflex. Carefree playtime's all good and fun, but I've been missin' this!)
(Helpin' out the folks I want to protect, slammin' my enemies into the dirt...)
(This is me, baby! This is the only life for Ranzal, the veteran merc!)
Nrg?! GRAAAURGH!
Down ya go!
Ha HA, lookit that! Ran it smack into a boulder. Makin' use of the terrain is Tactics 101.
Grrr...rrrngh...
Oooh, looks like he felt that one! Now, time to wrap this up.
Final score: Ranzal, 1. Fiend, 0. ...You guys okay? Got all your teeth?
We're fine! Thank you so much!
Whoa... You're CRAZY strong!
That's years of experience at work, buddy. I eat chumps like that for breakfast.
But, uh... Speakin' of, I need to tell you guys something. It's kinda important.
Huh? What is it?
Let's head back to the base. Won't have to worry 'bout any more interruptions there.
We can look up at the sky while we talk, same as we did the day we first met...
Sooo, yeah... I've been dreading telling you guys this, but here's the thing.
I'm movin' to a new town tomorrow. I know it's sudden, but...I won't be able to hang with you anymore.
No way...!
Gosh. I'm really gonna miss you, Ranzal.
I'll miss you, too. I've said my share of goodbyes—hell, probably more than my share—but this might be the hardest yet.
(I mean that, too. Seriously. You guys let me dream for a while.)
(But end of the day, I'm a grown man. Time to get back to reality and do my job.)
(It's a scary world out there. Somebody's gotta keep the peace so kids like you can have the carefree childhoods you deserve.)
We didn't have long together, but it was one hell of a ride. Thanks, you two.
I had a blast hanging out with you too, Ranzal!
I'll never, ever, EVER forget you!
I won't either! Never ever! ...Oh, yeah!
Here, take this. It's my prized possession: a super shiny medal!
Ooh, you should take mine, too. Bet you've never seen a bottle cap this cool!
Hey, now. If this stuff matters so much to you, shouldn't you hang on to it?
Take it! You're not just a normal friend, Ranzal.
Yeah! You're our leader!
It was so, so, SO much fun playing with you. Honest. Thanks for everything!
You guys...
Awright, then. If you're sure, I'll take 'em.
A guy couldn't ask for a better set a' souvenirs. I swear I'll treasure 'em always!
And don't think I'll be forgettin' you guys, either. Thanks for the great memories.
A few days later...
West woods're all clear of fiends, Cleo. Where to now?
Already? Er, next would be... the lake to the south.
You got it! Heh, watch out, pond scum. Ranzal's comin' for ya!
What's gotten into you lately, Ranzal? You always used to bellyache about having to hunt fiends, but now you're Mr. Eager.
Nothin' huge. Let's just say I... remembered my role in all this.
Thrashin' baddies, keepin' the peace... It's all part of a day's work for the commander of the Brat Brigade!
